name: Chicken tenders in peanut sauce
recipe: Heat half the oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Cook half the chicken, turning halfway, for 4 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining chicken.

Heat the remaining oil in the saucepan. Reduce heat to medium. Add the capsicum. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 7 minutes or until softened. Add the garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic. Stir in the curry powder and chilli, if you like. Cook for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Add the tomato paste and stir for 1 minute. Add the stock, peanut butter and thyme. Stir well to combine. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes or until mixture has thickened slightly. Season.
Return the chicken to the saucepan. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the chicken is just cooked though. Divide among serving plates. Drizzle with coconut milk and sprinkle with coriander.
